observations: The top left corner of the input is preserved in the output.
The input grid has a subgrid in the bottom right corner with different values.
The output grid uses values from the bottom-right subgrid of the input.
The output grid copies a specific sized subgrid from the input's bottom right corner.
The upper left portion of the input grid is transferred to the upper left portion of the output.
hypotheses: The output grid is a subgrid from the top-left corner concatenated with a subgrid from the bottom-right corner of the input grid.
The output grid consists of a fixed-size top-left subgrid from the input concatenated with a fixed-size bottom-right subgrid from the input.
The output grid is formed by taking a portion from the top left and replacing the remainder with a segment from the bottom right.
selected_rule: The output grid is a subgrid from the top-left corner concatenated with a subgrid from the bottom-right corner of the input grid.
step_plan: Identify the subgrid in the top left corner of the input.
Identify the subgrid in the bottom right corner of the input.
Concatenate these two subgrids to form the output grid.
